Description: Scarab carved from steatite; underside with incised decoration representing a crocodile (?) above some hieroglyphic signs (two Maat feathers, netjer and nefer signs); upper part of underside chipped.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Chautauqua Institution, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This piece is now lost. Brief description 'scarab, steatite' with sketch from Chautauqua distribution list of the Egypt Exploration Fund. It is possible to identify it with the stone scarab Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVIII no. 173. The drawing, much clearer in the publication matches the sketch and the publication states that it is made out of stone. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVIII, no. 173)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.22) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Chautauqua Institution, Chautauqua (NY)
